titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the George Campbell Peery Papers, 1899-1945
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 35134

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: 7.1 cu. ft. (in part, photocopies); scrapbooks on microfilm (Misc. reels 2298-3308).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Campbell Peery Papers, 1899-1945. Accession 35134, Personal Papers Collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ben H. Linberry, Tazewell, Virginia, 31 October 1995.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Born in Cedar Bluff, Tazewell County, Virginia on 28 October 1873. Graduate of Emory and Henry College (1894); Washington and Lee University law school (1897); member of U.S. House of Representatives (1923- 1929); governor of Virginia (1934-1938). Died in Richlands, Virginia on 14 October 1952. Buried in Maplewood Cemetery, Tazewell County, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Includes personal and general correspondence, 1899-1928, containing information mostly on Peery's law practice in Wise and Tazewell County, Virginia; speeches, 1913-1943 and undated, to civic organizations in Virginia, as well as some campaign addresses; campaign files, 1922-1925, which include correspondence; miscellaneous records, including West Point and Naval Academy appointments, 1924-1927, and information on Peery's residence in Wise, Virginia, dated 1908-1909; and scrapbooks.
